speaker: Outstanding Art Direction for a Multi-Camera Series
text: Roy Christopher, Amy Skjonsby-Winslow, Ron Olsen  * * *  ## Transcript {Mike Lee}    _ACT ONE Scene One -- Cafe Nervosa -- Morning Frasier is seated at a table.  Martin comes in, extremely full of himself. _

speaker: Martin
text: Large coffee to go, please. [_with heavy innuendo_] Black. [_sits with Frasier_] Whew, didn't get much sleep last night at Ronee's.  Don't ask why, �cause there are certain things a gentlemen doesn't tell.
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Art Direction for a Multi-Camera Series

speaker: Frasier
text: [_hoping he'll shut up_] Ah. _Martin crosses his arms with a smug, expectant grin on his face. Frasier refuses to take the hint.  Martin lets out a naughty chuckle._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, all right, I'll tell you just a little.  She's got this massage oil-

speaker: Frasier
text: Would you stop it!  I do not want to hear about your dirty weekend -- especially since the most erotic experience I've had in six months was last week's trouser fitting. _Niles enters with a GAP shopping bag.  He seems taken aback to see Frasier and Martin there._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles.

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: The GAP, Niles? I didn't know you shopped there.

speaker: Niles
text: I just discovered it.  Apparently there are a number of them.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_suspicious_] And what did you get there?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, uh, well, let's see... some wine glasses, and a bud vase-

speaker: Frasier
text: That's Pottery Barn, you jackass!  Give me that!

speaker: Frasier
text: Just as I thought. You bought the Diego sweater.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, what's the big deal?  It's just a sweater.

speaker: Frasier
text: It is not "just a sweater," it is a work of art by Spain's fabled master weaver Diego -- who uses only the soft chin hairs of Andalusian mountain goats.  Our sweater man could only get one this year.  Niles and I made a pact that neither of us would buy it. [_to Niles_] You can't even keep a simple sweater pact!

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, Ronee -- now there's a gal who can keep a sweater "packed!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop that! [_to Niles_] The least you can do is let me borrow it sometime.

speaker: Niles
text: Absolutely not!  You know Diego's weave conforms precisely to the contours of one's body.  Five minutes on you, I'd never be able to wear it again. [_N.B. Jane Leeves is still wearing her maternity prop._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello!

speaker: Niles
text: [_lowers voice_] Not a word about this.  We're saving money for the baby's college fund.  She'd kill me if she found out I spent half a semester on a sweater.

speaker: Martin
text: You want this?  I'm leaving.

speaker: Daphne
text: Where have you been?  You missed your massage this weekend.

speaker: Martin
text: [_smug grin_] That's what she thinks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just go!

speaker: Niles
text: [_to the waiter_] Can I get a coffee? [_to Daphne_] No biscotti?

speaker: Daphne
text: No.  I baked me own.  I decided a dollar-fifty was way too much to spend on a cookie.  Anyone? _She takes a plastic bag of cookies out of her purse.  Her words have given Frasier a wicked idea._

speaker: Niles
text: [_nervous_] Oh, thank you, my angel of thrift.

speaker: Niles
text: Good morning!

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, maybe yours was.  I just spent the last two hours waiting in line for this kiddie performer that Alice loves -- Nanny Gee [_Niles and Frasier's ears prick up_] - and the second I got to the window the show sold out.

speaker: Niles
text: Nanny Gee?  Frasier might be able to pull a few strings for you there. [_Frasier chuckles_]

speaker: Roz
text: Do you know Nanny Gee?  What, did you like date her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, I married her.

speaker: Roz
text: You married Nanny Gee?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah well, briefly.  It was years ago.  I was a callow, dreamy-eyed youth, and she was...

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, yeah, yeah, I need tickets!  She's at Kid Books right now, signing her new CD.  If you come with me...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right, all right, I'll see what I can do.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, and could you turn the heat up in here?  It's freezing.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_as he's leaving_] Oh, Niles has a sweater. _To Niles's horror, Daphne reaches for the shopping bag and pulls out the Diego._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, and it's from the Gap -- good boy!  Now help me stretch the neck out, I don't want to muss me hair. _Niles stares aghast as she gives the collar a hard tug and stretches it wide open.  FADE OUT_ **WHERE THE WILD THINGS ARE** _Scene Two -- Kid Books A long line of parents are standing with their children.  Nanny Gee, a woman in her early 40's wearing a brightly-colored costume and beret, is signing books and CDs at a table. _

speaker: Girl
text: [_getting her CD_] Thank you, Nanny Gee!

speaker: Roz
text: So what was it like being married to Nanny Gee?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, gosh... we were so young and immature.  We had huge fights over nothing.  But in the bedroom...

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry.

speaker: Roz
text: [_glances around_] So, uh, Nanny Gee gave you nice "hugs"?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, big hugs.

speaker: Roz
text: [_chuckling_] No kidding.

speaker: Frasier
text: We used to hug our brains out.  In fact, you know, the last time we saw each other she wanted to have a little reunion hug, but alas, I was still married to Lilith and settling for my weekly handshake.  [_N.B. The "Cheers" episode on which Nanny Gee appeared was entitled "One Hugs, The Other Doesn't."  Also, a slight discontinuity here: in[[9.02]](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_2/don_juan_in_hell_2.html "Don Juan in Hell \[2\]") "Don Juan In Hell[_2_], Nanette confessed that she made a lot of distracting noises._]

speaker: Roz
text: So, are you hoping for another hug?

speaker: Frasier
text: Mmm?  Well, the thought had crossed my mind.  You know, we used to have this wild attraction to each other -- it was almost combustible!  Truth be told, it's been a while since, I, uh... [_covers Alice's ears_] romped with abandon through the perfumed gardens of Eros.

speaker: Roz
text: Next time you say something like that, cover my ears.

speaker: Nanette
text: [_eyes on Alice_] And who's this for?

speaker: Frasier
text: Frasier.  F-R-A-

speaker: Nanette
text: [_looks up_] Frasier!  Oh, it's so good to see you again!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shakes her hand_] Nanette, hi.

speaker: Nanette
text: [_to Roz_] And you, you look great!  I've never such color in your cheeks...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, this isn't Lilith.  This is my co-worker, Roz, and her daughter, Alice.

speaker: Nanette
text: [_to Alice_] Hey, Alice.  How old are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm divorced now.

speaker: Alice
text: Five.

speaker: Nanette
text: Wow, five!

speaker: Frasier
text: Single again.

speaker: Nanette
text: You know what happens when you turn six?  You grow an extra finger! [_Alice laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Footloose, fancy-free...!

speaker: Roz
text: She's not biting.  Just get the tickets.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.  You know, Nanette, Alice was so hoping to see your show.  But alas, all the tickets are sold.

speaker: Nanette
text: Well, I think I can scare up three seats -- if you don't mind sitting in the front row.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, thank you, Nanny Gee!

speaker: Donald
text: Can I have everyone's attention?  Nanny Gee has to go to the theater now.  So... no more autographs.

speaker: Kids
text: Ohh...

speaker: Nanette
text: Gosh, I'm sorry.  But maybe we may have time for one more thing.  Would you like to hear a song?

speaker: Kids
text: Yeah!

speaker: Nanette
text: Does everyone know the Peek-A-Boo Song?

speaker: Kids
text: Yeah!

speaker: Nanette
text: Well, then you know what to do!

speaker: Nanette
text: [_covers her eyes, singing_] Peek-A-Boo...

speaker: Kids
text: Peek-A-Boo!

speaker: Nanette
text: Peek-A-Boo...

speaker: Kids
text: Peek-A-Boo!

speaker: Nanette
text: Someone's there, but oh my gosh, I don't know who! Is it you?

speaker: Kids
text: Peek-A-Boo!

speaker: Nanette
text: Give a clue!

speaker: Kids
text: Peek-A-Boo!

speaker: Nanette
text: Guess I'd better go and sneak a Peek-a-Boo! [_uncovers her eyes_]

speaker: Kids
text: Peek-A-Boo!

speaker: Nanette
text: That was great!  And now it's your turn to sing back to me, so I want everyone to cover their eyes!

speaker: Nanette
text: Ah-ah!  I said everyone! _Frasier, chuckling, covers his eyes, as do Roz and all the adults. Donald plays the tune again.  The kids start to sing..._

speaker: Kids
text: Peek-A-Boo...

speaker: Nanette
text: Peek-A-Boo!

speaker: Kids
text: Peek-A-Boo...

speaker: Nanette
text: Peek-A-Boo! _With that she turns and gooses Frasier.  As he uncovers his eyes in shock, she grabs him and kisses him lustily._

speaker: Kids
text: Someone's there, but oh my gosh, I don't know who! Is it you?

speaker: Nanette
text: [_past his lips_] Peek-A-Boo!

speaker: Kids
text: Give a clue!

speaker: Nanette
text: Peek-A-Boo! _They break apart, and lest he confuse the meaning of everything she's already done, she does a seductive grind while tugging at her breasts._

speaker: Kids
text: Guess I'd better go and sneak a Peek-a-Boo!

speaker: Nanette
text: Peek-A-Boo! _They uncover their eyes and everyone applauds, Frasier most enthusiastically of all._

speaker: Frasier
text: One more time! _FADE TO:  Scene Three -- Apartment Niles is waiting.  Martin is in his chair.  Frasier comes in with a cake box. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh hi, you guys.  I'm glad you're both here.  Guess who's coming by for a drink -- Nanette Gooseman.

speaker: Niles
text: Nanny Gee!

speaker: Martin
text: I don't suppose she's bringing her checkbook.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God, Dad, will you let it go?

speaker: Martin
text: I was still paying for that wedding six months after you two divorced!  Nannette didn't have any family, so she got off scot-free.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh yeah, orphans get all the breaks.  [__N.B. A second discontinuity here -- according to [[9.02]](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_2/don_juan_in_hell_2.html "Don Juan in Hell \[2\]") "Father of the Bride," Frasier's first wedding was a quick affair dashed off at city hall, presumably by a justice of the peace.__]

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Frasier, Dad and Ronee are joining us for dinner, why don't you two come along?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually, Niles, I'm planning a bit of an intimate evening myself.

speaker: Niles
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: She wants me!

speaker: Martin
text: Are you sure?  You said that last week about the cable lady, and she just had something in her eye.

speaker: Frasier
text: She hit on me in the children's bookstore -- where I bought her CD. Trust me, the woman is a sexual volcano just waiting to erupt!

speaker: Niles
text: [_examining the CD_] Judging from some of these song titles, you may be right.  "Nanny's Messy Bed," "I Feel Something Great Inside Me," "Bannisters are Fun"...

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey. [_they ad-lib hellos_]

speaker: Niles
text: My sweater -- weren't you wearing it when you went out?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, but Eddie was pulling me along so fast, I started sweating like a blacksmith.  I could smell the lamb curry I had for lunch just wafting out my pores.  But don't worry, it's right here. _She opens her purse, where the sweater is bunched into a ball. She notices something._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, great! [_extracts a cookie_] That was me last butterscotch, now it's all fuzzy!

speaker: Frasier
text: That'll be Nanette! _He dashes over and opens the door to Nanette, wearing an evening dress. She grabs him again._

speaker: Frasier
text: Nanette!

speaker: Nanette
text: God, I could throw you down on this floor right now and... [_sees the rest_] Hi!

speaker: Frasier
text: Here, let me take your wrap.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_aside to Martin_] Isn't she the children's entertainer?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, SpongeBob Hotpants.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nanette, you remember my dad, of course, and Niles, and this is his wife, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, it's nice to meet you.

speaker: Nanette
text: Oh, it's nice to meet you too. [_hugs Niles_] And oh, I don't think I've seen you since the wedding!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I remember that day.  All those nice friends of yours came.  What was it - sixty, seventy?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, okay, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: I know, because, only fifty RSVP'd.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's all right.  You know, sadly, this bunch is going out this evening, so it'll be just the two of us.

speaker: Donald
text: Hey!

speaker: Nanette
text: And Donald.

speaker: Frasier
text: Donald?

speaker: Donald
text: Hey, put her there -- Don Burwell.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shaking hands_] Frasier Crane, uh...

speaker: Nanette
text: Donald, here, does - well, just about everything for me. He's my manager, producer, songwriter, publicist-

speaker: Donald
text: Husband.

speaker: Nanette
text: I was getting there.  And when I told him where I was going, well he just had to come along to meet you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, uh... gosh, who wants wine?  I know I do!

speaker: Nanette
text: I'll help! [_follows him_] Donald, introduce yourself! _Reset to: Kitchen Frasier storms in, followed by Nannette._

speaker: Frasier
text: And just when were you planning on telling me you have a husband?

speaker: Nanette
text: He produces my show, it's a marriage of convenience.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, at the moment it's not!

speaker: Nanette
text: Come on, give Nanny some sugar!

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop-stop it, stop it!  Donald will see us.

speaker: Nanette
text: Well, say that you're short on something and send him to the store.  He's good at errands!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not going to send him on an errand.  He's your husband!

speaker: Nanette
text: It's just business.  It's nothing compared to what we had. [_fondling his chest_] Do you remember the passion... and the wildness?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_weakens_] Well, we are running low on cornichons... _Reset to: Living Room Donald is standing with his back to the kitchen, telling the rest about their recent tour.  Over his shoulder, all Martin, Niles and Daphne see is Frasier and Nanette in a clinch against the refrigerator._

speaker: Donald
text: Not only did we break house records in Boise and Topeka, but she hasn't missed a show.  She just, she lives to entertain children.

speaker: Niles
text: Of all ages.  Don, come out and look at the balcony. _Niles hurriedly steers Donald onto the balcony.  Reset to: Kitchen Frasier pushes her away._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God!  Have we lost our minds?

speaker: Nanette
text: Frasier, if you knew how bored I am, being "Nanny Gee." [_pours herself a big glass of wine_] How trapped I feel...

speaker: Frasier
text: You have a wonderful career.

speaker: Nanette
text: But nothing ever changes!  Do you have any idea what it's like to play the same character for twenty years?  [_N.B. An inside joke here -- 2004 is Kelsey Grammer's twentieth year in the role of Frasier Crane.  This line got the biggest laugh from the studio audience, who had been told this in advance._]

speaker: Frasier
text: But... you've brought joy to countless small children.

speaker: Nanette
text: Yeah, well, there are times you want to bring joy to somebody big enough to throw a little back at you. _She grabs him again, he pushes her away and carries out the tray of wine glasses.  Reset to: Living Room_

speaker: Frasier
text: Who wants wine?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sotto voce_] Oh, that'll cool her right down.

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, none for us, we really have to go.

speaker: Martin
text: [_getting up as Donald reenters_] Yeah.  Uh, nice to meet you, Donald.  And, uh, Fras, see you in a few hours.

speaker: Donald
text: [_cheerfully_] So, looks like a threesome tonight.

speaker: Martin
text: Maybe I'll just stay at Ronee's. _Martin, Daphne, and Niles exit.  Frasier and Nanette stand uneasily with glasses of wine._

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, uh... here we all are. _Donald's cell phone rings -- it is set to the tune of "The Peek-A-Boo Song."  Nanette looks like she wants to scream.  Frasier sits on the couch and takes a big sip of his wine. _

speaker: Donald
text: Hello?  Ar-are you sure? [_to the others_] Mr. Bunny's using again. [_into phone_] Do you have anyone to replace him?

speaker: Nanette
text: Donald, we are guests here!  Take that outside.

speaker: Nanette
text: Honestly, the man has no manners.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_forces her away_] Cut that out!

speaker: Nanette
text: Oh, I can't help myself.  I've never stopped thinking about you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nor I you, but this is wrong.

speaker: Nanette
text: Oh Frasier, you're so good.  You always do the right thing. I have the exact same problem.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you're making great strides overcoming it.

speaker: Nanette
text: [_checks the balcony_] Well, I'm tired of being good. [_sits up_] I've sung my songs and cheered people up. [_lifts her glass_] Haven't I earned the right to be a little bad?  Isn't there a part of you that wants to be bad?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and three guesses which one.  I-I... I can't do it.

speaker: Nanette
text: Come to my dressing room after the show tomorrow.  I have an hour when Donald's busy.  I know an hour's not much...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_overcome_] Trust me, an hour's more than ample.

speaker: Donald
text: Well, I just hope he shows up tomorrow.  That bunny suit is just so darn tight on me. _Frasier gets up and crosses to the dining table, where he takes a tray of pastries out of the cake box._

speaker: Frasier
text: Donald, you know, you really must try one of these Gruyere tarts.

speaker: Donald
text: Oh, no thanks.  I'm watching the old cholesterol.

speaker: Nanette
text: So am I -- but you know what?  I just feel like being bad tonight. [_takes one_] What about you, Frasier?  Are you going to be bad?

speaker: Donald
text: Ah, go on -- what's one little tart? _Frasier and Nanette eat their tarts, exchanging a complicitous smile.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Four -- Cafe Nervosa. Niles is at the window seat.  Frasier rushes in. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles-

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it shows its face.  What was that last night?

speaker: Frasier
text: Relax, relax, nothing happened.  My problem now is that she's invited me to her dressing room for an... _apr�s_ -show tryst.

speaker: Niles
text: You're not going?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well...

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, if you had any idea how much pain she's in.  The woman is reaching out to me to rescue her from a loveless marriage, from-from a career she feels trapped in.  If I could help her make a new beginning, wouldn't it be heartless of me to deny myself to her?

speaker: Niles
text: ...Did you say something?  Your penis was talking so loud I couldn't hear.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right!  I want her and she wants me!

speaker: Niles
text: She's-married.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I married her first!  "Till death us do part," as I recall!  Now you may not take those vows seriously, but I do.

speaker: Niles
text: Will you listen to yourself?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, this is more than just sex, Niles!  This is passion, Wouldn't the real sin be to refuse it?

speaker: Niles
text: Isn't that your old second-piece-of-pie argument?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe it is, _but I haven't had "pie" in six months!_

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, you can rationalize this any way you want.  But the question is, if you do this, can you live with yourself afterwards?

speaker: Roz
text: Ready for the concert?

speaker: Niles
text: [_rising_] Hey, Alice.

speaker: Alice
text: Hi, Uncle Niles! _She gives him a big hug, making him laugh.  Seeing Frasier, she grabs Roz and drags her out again._

speaker: Alice
text: Come on, Mommy, let's go!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, oh, oh -- no hugs for Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sadly_] No... no hugs for Frasier. **BRIGHT LIGHTS, BIG PROBLEM** _Scene Five -- Theater Backstage Frasier knocks on a dressing room door.  The star says, "Nanny G." Nanette opens the door, dressed in her costume. _

speaker: Nanette
text: Frasier, I thought you were coming after the show.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I can't.

speaker: Nanette
text: Well, we have ten minutes, let me just get rid of- [_yells into the room_] Donald!

speaker: Donald
text: [_o.s._] Huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no. I can't do this at all.

speaker: Nanette
text: What?

speaker: Donald
text: [_o.s._] Huh?

speaker: Nanette
text: [_into room_] Nothing, just sit there!

speaker: Frasier
text: God knows I'm tempted, but this is wrong.  I-I'm sorry you've been so unhappy in your life lately, but... if you want to talk, we can meet later, at the coffee shop next door.

speaker: Nanette
text: Well, why can't we talk now?

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't you have a show to do?

speaker: Nanette
text: They can't start without me.  Here, come with me. _Scene Six -- Prop Room Nanette leads Frasier down some stairs to a room full of sets and props. In the center is a king-sized bed draped with bright, playful covers. _

speaker: Frasier
text: What is this place?

speaker: Nanette
text: It's the prop room.  This is where I come before every show to fight off the emptiness and the nausea that comes over me.

speaker: Nanette
text: You don't know how many times I've sat down here, curled up in a ball, vomiting like a wino. [_chokes back a sob_] Hold me, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_tempted again, but_] I can't.  You're married.  And these shoes are suede.  Look, I-I realize that you're at a crossroads right now, and if I can help you reach a decision...

speaker: Nanette
text: [_gets up_] I can't go on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Then don't.  Make a break, redefine yourself-

speaker: Nanette
text: No, I mean now.  This show, I can't go on.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  Cancel?

speaker: Nanette
text: I can't go out there and sing and dance and pretend to be a happy lady when the love of my life has just rejected me. _Weeping, she lays face-down on the bed -- making sure to push her behind up into the air. _

speaker: Frasier
text: [_weakening_] Oh, Nanette, I... I realize that you're upset, but-but think of little Alice, and-and the children.

speaker: Nanette
text: [_lays on her back_] Oh, let them learn now that life is filled with bitter disappointments.

speaker: Frasier
text: But, Nanette... _Nanette rips open the front of her costume, exposing her neglig ee. _

speaker: Nanette
text: Oh, make me a happy lady, Frasier.  And then I can go on.

speaker: Frasier
text: For the children! _He jumps on her.  They embrace passionately for a moment, then Frasier breaks away and quickly undresses._

speaker: Nanette
text: [_helping him_] I'll get the belt... _CUT TO: Theater Alice and Roz are sitting eagerly in the front row.  Roz looks down the aisle for Frasier, then checks her watch.  CUT TO: Prop Room Frasier is down to his boxers, as Nanette lays back on the bed._

speaker: Nanette
text: Take me, Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!  Yes!

speaker: Nanette
text: Oh!  Oh God!  How I've dreamed of this moment!  Have you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you kidding? [_reaches down, pulls off his boxers, and flings them away_] I dreamed of it twice last night! _They start necking passionately... then the ceiling opens above them and the bed starts to rise on a hydraulic lift._

speaker: Nanette
text: Oh my God!

speaker: Frasier
text: Already?

speaker: Nanette
text: [_pushes him off her_] Oh, no!  I thought we had more time! Quick, get off the bed! _P.O.V. Looking down through the opening as the bed rises toward the light, as Frasier and Nanette scramble:_

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God!  Why is the ceiling opening up?!

speaker: Nanette
text: This is how I make my entrance! [_re-buttoning her costume_] GET OFF THE BED!

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't, I can't!  I'm tangled in the sheets!

speaker: Nanette
text: Oh, my God!  Jump!

speaker: Frasier
text: Jump?  It's too high!

speaker: Nanette
text: Aim for your clothes!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_realizing_] Dear God, my clothes!

speaker: Nanette
text: Oh, hide!  For God's sake, just hide! [_N.B. All of the following scenes were shot earlier at the Bogart Theater in Los Angeles.  The audience was shown the scenes on the monitors, to record the laugh track.  In fact, the audience laughed so loud the volume had to be decreased for the broadcast just so the action could be heard._] _As the bed rises into a playful bedroom set, the orchestra strikes up, and the audience cheers, waving "NANNY G" pennants.  Under the covers:_

speaker: Nanette
text: You have got to get out of this bed!

speaker: Frasier
text: Can't I just hide here until the show's over?

speaker: Nanette
text: Trust me, that ain't gonna work. _Finished re-buttoning her costume, she sits up, with a big smile on her face.  The audience applauds, and as the orchestra starts the first number, she stretches her arms over her head and yawns. A rooster crows._

speaker: Nanette
text: [_singing_] When it's time to rise, I yawn and rub my eyes, because I'm such a sleepyhead But rise I do, �Cause I'm dying to see what's new In Nanny's messy bed _Frasier risks lifting the covers enough to see out, and quickly ducks down again when he sees the whole audience in plain view._

speaker: Nanette
text: There might be treats, Last week I found a pizza And a chimpanzee named Fred [_gets out and starts dancing_] So kids, what say, we see what we find today in Nanny's messy bed? _Four actors wearing animal costumes enter from behind the bed and jump on it -- and Frasier -- before jumping down to the stage to dance. _

speaker: Nanette
text: There's always something new It's Mr. Kangaroo!

speaker: Bunnies
text: Some bunny rabbits, too!

speaker: Panda
text: And a Panda! _Instrumental.  As Nanette and the animals dance around the bed, Frasier peeks out and whispers to the nearest one._

speaker: Frasier
text: Psst!  Panda!

speaker: Panda
text: [_keeps dancing_] Who the hell are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dr. Frasier Crane, a noted psychiatrist.  When does the bed go back to the basement?

speaker: Panda
text: A new set comes on, the bed flies out to the rafters -- fast. _Nanette stands on the bed and lifts the cover over herself -- seeing Frasier but keeping him covered from the audience. _

speaker: All
text: What a mess! What a mess! What a messy, messy, messy, messy bad! What a mess! Nonetheless...

speaker: Nanette
text: With all the time I spend in it, it's nice to have a friend in it!

speaker: Frasier
text: You have got to get me out of here.  The thing's about to fly up to the rafters!

speaker: Nanette
text: Gee, I didn't know that, having only done this show 12,000 times! _As the others continue singing, she ducks under the covers and pulls something out of the front of her costume._

speaker: Nanette
text: Put this on.

speaker: Frasier
text: You can't be serious!

speaker: Nanette
text: Just put it on now!

speaker: Actors
text: Messy bed...

speaker: Nanette
text: Oh, hi boys and girls!

speaker: Audience
text: [_including Roz and Alice_] Hi, Nanny Gee!

speaker: Nanette
text: Well, I guess I guess I'd better make my bed!

speaker: Kangaroo
text: You don't have to, Nanny Gee!  I have a magic wand that can make it fly away until it's nighttime again! [_waves the wand_] Al-a-ka-

speaker: Nanette
text: WAIT! I think there's something in there that I haven't found yet! [_looks and gasps_] It's the best surprise ever -- it's a new baby brother! _She flips the sheet up, revealing Frasier wearing nothing but an oversized comedy diaper and baby bonnet.  The audience roars with laughter.  Alice puts a hand to her mouth, giggling. Roz just stares._

speaker: Nanette
text: Oh, what's the matter, little guy?  You look kind of sad. Are you going to cry? [_urges him with her eyes_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Waaaa!

speaker: Nanette
text: Oh, sounds like somebody could use some cheering up. Let's sing him the "Hoppity-Hop" song.

speaker: Kangaroo
text: [_under his breath_] We cut "Hoppity-Hop" in Detroit.

speaker: Nanette
text: [_through her teeth_] Well, put it back in! _The orchestra master changes his sheet music, and begins.  The animals form up._

speaker: Nanette
text: [_singing_] When I'm blue, just like you When it's not my day I hop, hop, hoppity-hop Hop my troubles away [_to Frasier_] Come on! _Nanette and the animals dance around the bed.  Frasier has no choice but to get off the bed and do the same._

speaker: All
text: When a bee stings my knee When I lose a toy I hop, hop, hoppity-hop and soon I'm jumping for joy! _Frasier struggles madly to ape their choreography and lip-sync the words, darting glances at Nanette and the others.  Roz looks incredulous._

speaker: All
text: We were feeling sad Now we're feeling snappy We were hopping mad Now we're hopping happy!  So when you think people stink Let your knees just bend And hop, hop, hoppity-hop and watch your grumpiness end! _As they reach stage left, Frasier tries to slip offstage, but runs headlong into Donald, who is staring at him, enraged.  Frasier can only continue back across the stage, dancing in a line with Nanette and the animals._

speaker: All
text: Hop, hop, hoppity-hop and soon you'll make a new friend... _Roz puts a hand over her eyes.  END OF ACT TWO_
